info.name: Prodigi API V4: Public Collection
info.description:
### A COLLECTION OF PRODIGI API VERSION 4 CALLS FOR ILLUSTRATIVE PURPOSES FOR CLIENTS.

New clients must create an account to obtain API credentials. Go [here](https://dashboard.prodigi.com/register) to sign up.

**NOTE**: This collection uses an environment setup to make use of the Prodigi sandbox. The following variables are empty and need to be supplied:

**{{X-API-KEY}}** â€“ Your REST API Key supplied by the Prodigi Dashboard

### URLs

All requests should be made over HTTPS. Connections cannot be made via HTTP. Please note that support for SSL 3.0 has been disabled and we recommend using TLS 1.0 or better.

Testing and development should be done against the sandbox API. This is an environment where you can create, and submit orders without incurring any costs.

#### Sandbox API URL

[https://api.sandbox.prodigi.com](https://api.sandbox.prodigi.com)

#### Live API URL

[https://api.prodigi.com](https://api.prodigi.com)

### Format

#### Request format

Requests should be made using either JSON.

The Content-type header should be set accordingly to either Content-type: application/json.

#### Response format

All responses are formatted as application/json.

item.name: Order Operations

request.description: POSTing to this endpoint will submit and create your order for you.

response.name: Create Order

request.description:
This endpoint returns a list of Orders based on the filtering options given- which are all optional. See [here](https://www.prodigi.com/print-api/docs/reference/#get-orders) for the filtering options available.

In this example, top is used.

response.name: GET Orders

request.description: This returns an order for a given Prodigi order ID

response.name: GET Order by ID

request.description: This endpoint will return the actions available to take against a particular order: updating metadata, recipient and/or shipping method, and cancelling the order.

Allows you to replace the existing metadata for a given order.
Please see [here](https://www.prodigi.com/print-api/docs/reference/#update-metadata) for further information about metadata.

response.name: Update Metadata on Order

request.description: Allows you to change the recipient details for a given order

response.name: Update Recipient on Order

request.description: Allows you to change the shipping method for a given order

response.name: Update Shipping Method on Order

request.description: Attempts to cancel the entire order by sending a POST request for a specific prodigi_order_id.

response.name: Cancel an Order

item.description:
Use these operations to create, retrieve and update orders.

#### Submitting for production

To submit an order for processing, it is done through a single API request by making a POST call to /v4.0/Orders. Once the order has been created and is in our system, the fulfilment process starts immediately.

item.name: Quotes

response.name: Create Quote

item.description:
This endpoint allows you to get pricing and shipping information about a given set of products. To read more about our quoting endpoint, please see [here](https://www.prodigi.com/print-api/docs/reference/#quotes)
 
**NOTE**: This does not create the order

item.name: Product Details

response.name: Get Product Details

item.description: This endpoint returns all available data for a SKU such as price, attributes, variants, and its required assets and dimensions. Please see [here](https://www.prodigi.com/print-api/docs/reference/#product-details) for further information about this endpoint.

item.name: Photobooks

request.description: POSTing to this endpoint will submit and create your order for you.

response.name: Create Order

item.description:
This folder includes a sample order that you can use to get started with ordering a photobook with Prodigi.

To place an order, simply change the address for your own and provide a publicly accessible link to a PDF file containing the book contents.

The example photobook SKU used here is for an 21cm square hardback book. The complete range of books available - and the appropriate SKU to use for each - can be found [here](https://www.prodigi.com/download/private/prodigi-photo-book-pricing.pdf).
